about.title: About Me
about.name: Yu-Ting Chen
about.description: Born in 1997, graduated and worked for two years

page.title: Self Introduction
page.intro_work: Born in 1997, I started working at Titansoft in February 2020, progressing from intern to full-time employee until April 2023, working for nearly 3 years in total.
page.belief: I believe technology is a tool for solving problems, so I'm willing to learn any technology if there's a problem that needs to be solved.
page.challenge_intro: I love challenging myself with new experiences and always strive to try anything that can make me better.
page.timeline_2018: 2018 Joined student association, became a team leader, cycled around Taiwan (second time), attended music festivals
page.timeline_2019: 2019 Participated in National IT Application Competition, paragliding
page.timeline_2023_1: 2023 Started YouTube content creation, entrepreneurship attempt, passed JLPT N2,
page.timeline_2024: 2024 Studying in Japan for a year at a language school
page.closing: Please hire me. While I may not be the strongest technically, I will definitely bring value to the company.

titansoft_engineer.title: Product Development Engineer at Titansoft
description: After becoming a full-time engineer, I learned a lot about agile development (scrum), industry domain knowledge, microservices, and developed APIs (REST, gRPC). I also learned unit testing (xUnit, NUnit, fluent Assertion), integration testing (SpecFlow), and worked with Vue 3.0 for frontend development.
My code quality has improved after reading Clean Code and understanding code smells. While there's still room for improvement, it's much better than before...

titansoft_intern.title: Intern at Titansoft
description: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, I only worked in the office for a month before switching to remote work. I was fortunate to be a 2020 Titansoft intern, and although I still wrote some messy code, I learned a lot.

I learned .NET Core MVC development and MSSQL, which were new to me as they weren't taught in school. I also tried useful tools like LINQ and jQuery, focused on writing better code, and collaborated with the team. It was a great experience!

ta.title: Programming Course Teaching Assistant
description: I served as a teaching assistant for the programming course, teaching Java and programming techniques to non-CS majors. Teaching students with no programming background helped me develop patience and attention to detail. Being recognized by peers for my ability to teach gave me a great sense of achievement.

competition.title: 24th College Information Application Service Innovation Competition
competition.subtitle: 3rd Place in Information Application Category
description: Due to excellent performance in my senior project, my professor recommended me for the competition. During the research, we improved the algorithm with the professor, adopting an innovative separated structure encryption method that revolutionized encryption/decryption. I learned about teamwork and project implementation. Creating a new algorithm and implementing it gave me a sense of achievement and increased my enthusiasm for programming.

azure.description: This is a simple website using Azure that supports CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations.

level.description: This project was developed using Flutter and Firebase and has been published on Google Play. Its main goal is to help people become more self-disciplined.

encryption.description: This is an encryption system developed for my senior project. We improved the existing AES algorithm and created an innovative encryption method. We participated in a competition with this project and achieved good results.

java_game.description: This was my first-year Java programming assignment. It represents my initial excitement about programming. I really enjoyed creating this game, even though it was quite basic.

desktop_pet.description: This is a desktop pet application I created in my sophomore year. I wanted a therapeutic companion, so I decided to program one.
